title: Tesla Surpasses $1 Trillion Market Cap Again
summary: Tesla reclaims its position in the trillion-dollar club as EV demand surges across global markets.
body: Tesla Inc. has once again crossed the $1 trillion market capitalization threshold, driven by record delivery numbers and expanding manufacturing capacity. Analysts point to strong demand in China and Europe as key catalysts, alongside growing momentum in the energy storage segment.

title: Cybertruck Deliveries Exceed Expectations
summary: Q4 Cybertruck numbers come in 40% above analyst consensus.
body: Tesla's Cybertruck has defied skeptics with delivery numbers far exceeding Wall Street expectations. The angular pickup truck has found strong demand in both consumer and fleet segments, with the tri-motor variant commanding significant premiums.

title: Megapack Revenue Doubles Year-Over-Year
summary: Tesla Energy division posts record revenue as utility-scale storage demand accelerates.
body: Tesla's energy storage business continues its explosive growth trajectory, with Megapack deployments doubling compared to the same quarter last year. The Lathrop, California factory is now operating at full capacity, and a second Megapack factory is under construction.

title: FSD v13 Begins Supervised Rollout
summary: Full Self-Driving version 13 marks a new generation of neural net architecture.
body: Tesla has commenced the supervised rollout of FSD v13, which features an entirely new end-to-end neural network architecture. Early reports from beta testers indicate significant improvements in intersection handling and highway navigation.

title: EU Tariff Debate Could Impact Tesla Margins
summary: Proposed European tariff adjustments create uncertainty for EV manufacturers.
body: The European Union is deliberating new tariff structures that could affect Tesla's competitive positioning in the region. While Tesla's Berlin Gigafactory provides some insulation from import duties, the broader regulatory environment remains a key variable for analyst models.

title: Q4 Earnings Preview: What to Watch
summary: Key metrics and consensus estimates ahead of Tesla's quarterly report.
body: As Tesla approaches its Q4 earnings release, analysts are focused on automotive gross margins, energy storage revenue growth, and any updates on the next-generation vehicle platform. Consensus expects EPS of $0.92 on revenue of $28.4 billion.

title: Model Y Refresh Drives Record Orders in China
summary: Updated Model Y sees unprecedented reservation numbers in first 48 hours.
body: The refreshed Model Y, codenamed Juniper, has generated record reservation numbers in China within its first 48 hours of availability. The updated design, improved range, and enhanced interior have resonated strongly with Chinese consumers.

title: Optimus Robot Enters Factory Testing Phase
summary: Tesla's humanoid robot begins practical deployment in controlled factory environments.
body: Tesla's Optimus humanoid robot has moved beyond the lab and into supervised factory testing at the Fremont facility. The robots are performing simple repetitive tasks alongside human workers, marking a significant milestone in Tesla's robotics ambitions.

title: Tesla Insurance Expands to 10 New States
summary: Real-time driving behavior scoring now available across more of the US.
body: Tesla Insurance, which uses real-time driving data to calculate premiums, has expanded its availability to 10 additional US states. The expansion brings the total coverage area to 30 states, with plans to reach nationwide availability by year-end.

title: Battery Cost Reduction Ahead of Schedule
summary: 4680 cell production costs drop faster than internal targets projected.
body: Tesla's 4680 battery cell production has achieved cost reduction milestones ahead of schedule at its Texas facility. The improvements are expected to flow through to improved automotive gross margins in upcoming quarters and accelerate the timeline for more affordable vehicle offerings.

title: Supercharger V4 Network Reaches 75,000 Stalls Globally
summary: Tesla's rapid charging infrastructure hits another milestone as V4 stations dominate new installs.
body: Tesla's Supercharger network has surpassed 75,000 stalls worldwide, with the majority of new installations featuring the V4 architecture capable of 350kW+ charging speeds. The network expansion is a key competitive moat, with non-Tesla EV owners increasingly relying on the NACS standard.

title: Tesla Solar Roof Installations Surge 120%
summary: Residential solar adoption accelerates as costs fall and energy rates rise.
body: Tesla's Solar Roof product has seen a 120% increase in installations year-over-year, driven by falling manufacturing costs and rising utility electricity rates. The product, which integrates solar cells directly into roof tiles, is now available in 42 states with average installation times dropping to under a week.

title: Robotaxi Pilot Program Expands to San Francisco
summary: Tesla's autonomous ride-hailing service adds its second city after Austin launch.
body: Tesla has expanded its Robotaxi pilot program to San Francisco, following a successful initial launch in Austin, Texas. The service uses Tesla vehicles equipped with FSD v13 and operates in designated zones with remote human oversight. Early ride data shows a 99.7% safety completion rate.

title: Giga Mexico Construction Begins Foundation Work
summary: Tesla's next North American factory breaks ground in Monterrey, targeting late 2027 production.
body: Construction crews have broken ground on Tesla's Gigafactory Mexico, located in Monterrey. The factory will produce the next-generation affordable Tesla model and is expected to begin production in late 2027, creating over 8,000 local jobs.

title: Tesla Secures $2B Contract for Australian Grid Storage
summary: Largest single Megapack deal ever signed with the Australian Energy Market Operator.
body: Tesla Energy has secured a landmark $2 billion contract to supply Megapack battery storage systems across multiple sites in Australia. The deal represents the largest single energy storage contract in history and will provide grid stabilization for the Australian National Electricity Market.

title: FSD v13.2 Update Handles Rain and Snow Conditions
summary: Major software update dramatically improves autonomous driving in adverse weather.
body: Tesla has released FSD v13.2, which includes significant improvements in handling adverse weather conditions including rain, snow, and fog. The update uses new radar fusion data from the latest Model 3 and Model Y vehicles to improve perception in low-visibility scenarios.

title: Model 3 Highland Becomes Europe's Best-Selling Car
summary: Not just best-selling EV — Tesla Model 3 tops ALL vehicle sales in Europe for February.
body: The refreshed Tesla Model 3 Highland has achieved an unprecedented milestone: becoming the overall best-selling car in Europe — not just among EVs, but across all powertrains. The feat highlights the mainstream tipping point for electric vehicles on the continent.

title: Optimus Gen 2 Demonstrates Household Tasks
summary: Tesla showcases updated humanoid robot folding laundry, cooking, and cleaning at live demo.
body: At a special event at Tesla's Palo Alto headquarters, the Optimus Gen 2 robot demonstrated a range of household tasks including folding laundry, preparing simple meals, and vacuuming. While still requiring human supervision, the demonstrations showed a dramatic improvement in fine motor control.

title: Q1 Delivery Estimates Raised by Major Analysts
summary: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley raise Q1 delivery forecasts citing strong order backlogs.
body: Multiple Wall Street firms have raised their Q1 2026 delivery estimates for Tesla, with Goldman Sachs now projecting 520,000 vehicles and Morgan Stanley at 515,000. The upward revisions are driven by strong Model Y Juniper orders and continued Cybertruck ramp.

title: Tesla Launches Commercial Vehicle Division
summary: New business unit to focus on electric semi trucks, vans, and fleet solutions.
body: Tesla has formally established a Commercial Vehicle Division, consolidating its Semi truck program with new electric van and fleet management offerings. The division will target logistics companies, ride-hailing fleets, and commercial delivery operations.

title: NHTSA Approves Tesla for Level 3 Autonomy in Select States
summary: Regulatory breakthrough allows hands-free, eyes-off driving on highways in 5 states.
body: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has granted Tesla conditional approval for Level 3 autonomous driving on select highway routes in California, Texas, Arizona, Nevada, and Florida. This marks the first time a non-luxury automaker has received L3 approval in the United States.

title: Giga Berlin Achieves 10,000 Vehicles Per Week
summary: European factory reaches production milestone 6 months ahead of schedule.
body: Tesla's Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg has achieved a production rate of 10,000 vehicles per week, reaching its medium-term target six months ahead of schedule. The facility now produces both Model Y and Model 3 variants, with 4680 battery cell production ramping on-site.

title: Cybertruck Gets Tow Range Boost via OTA Update
summary: Software update improves towing efficiency by 18% through drivetrain optimization.
body: A new over-the-air software update for the Cybertruck has improved towing range by approximately 18% through optimized drivetrain management and regenerative braking algorithms. Owners pulling trailers and boats report real-world improvements of 40-60 additional miles when towing at highway speeds.

title: Tesla Powerwall 3 Outsells All Home Battery Competitors Combined
summary: Market dominance grows as Powerwall captures 62% of residential battery storage market.
body: Tesla's Powerwall 3 has captured over 62% of the US residential battery storage market, outselling all competitors combined. The product's integration with Tesla Solar Roof, electric vehicles, and the Tesla app energy management ecosystem gives it a significant competitive advantage.

title: Short Sellers Face Record Losses on TSLA
summary: Bears lose over $12 billion as Tesla stock continues its 2026 rally.
body: Short sellers betting against Tesla have suffered record losses exceeding $12 billion in 2026 as the stock continues its upward trajectory. The losses come as Tesla delivers on multiple growth vectors simultaneously — vehicles, energy, AI, and robotics.

title: Robotaxi Revenue Run Rate Hits $500M Annually
summary: Tesla's autonomous ride-hailing pilot in Austin and SF generates surprise revenue.
body: Tesla's Robotaxi pilot programs in Austin and San Francisco have achieved a combined revenue run rate of approximately $500 million annually, far exceeding early projections. The high utilization rates and low per-mile operating costs are validating the economics of autonomous ride-hailing.

title: Competition Heats Up: BYD Closes Gap in Global EV Sales
summary: Chinese rival narrows the gap but Tesla maintains lead in revenue and margins.
body: BYD continues to close the gap with Tesla in terms of total EV units sold globally, though Tesla maintains a significant lead in revenue per vehicle and profit margins. The competitive dynamic is driving both companies to accelerate innovation and cost reduction efforts.

title: Tesla Semi Fleet Hits 10,000 Trucks on US Roads
summary: Electric semi truck adoption accelerates as total cost of ownership advantages become clear.
body: Tesla has now delivered over 10,000 Semi trucks to fleet operators across the United States. Major customers including PepsiCo, Walmart, and FedEx report fuel cost savings exceeding 60% compared to diesel trucks, with maintenance costs down approximately 40%.

title: Tesla Opens Supercharger Network to All Major EV Brands
summary: Ford, GM, Rivian, and Hyundai vehicles now able to charge at all Tesla Supercharger locations.
body: Tesla's Supercharger network is now fully open to vehicles from Ford, GM, Rivian, Hyundai, and BMW, following the adoption of the NACS charging standard. The move generates additional high-margin revenue for Tesla while simplifying the charging experience for all EV owners.

title: Q1 2026 Earnings: Tesla Beats on Revenue and EPS
summary: Record quarterly revenue of $31.2B and EPS of $1.08 smash consensus estimates.
body: Tesla has reported Q1 2026 earnings that beat Wall Street estimates across every major metric. Revenue came in at $31.2 billion versus consensus of $29.1 billion, while EPS of $1.08 exceeded the $0.94 estimate. Automotive gross margins expanded to 19.8%, up from 17.9% a year ago.

title: Optimus Robots Begin Retail Pre-Orders
summary: Tesla opens pre-order reservations for Optimus at $25,000, with first deliveries in 2027.
body: In a surprise announcement during the Q1 earnings call, Elon Musk revealed that Tesla is now accepting $1,000 pre-order deposits for the Optimus humanoid robot. Priced at approximately $25,000, the robot is intended for household assistance and light commercial tasks, with first deliveries expected in mid-2027.

title: Next-Gen Affordable Tesla Spotted Testing in California
summary: Camouflaged prototype of the sub-$30,000 Tesla hatchback photographed near Palo Alto.
body: A heavily camouflaged prototype of Tesla's upcoming affordable vehicle has been spotted testing on public roads near the company's Palo Alto engineering center. The compact hatchback, expected to start under $30,000, will be Tesla's most affordable vehicle yet and is targeting production at Giga Mexico.

title: Tesla Energy Revenue Surpasses Ford's Total Automotive Revenue
summary: Tesla's energy division alone now generates more revenue than Ford's entire car business.
body: In a stunning milestone, Tesla's Energy Generation and Storage segment has reported quarterly revenue that exceeds Ford Motor Company's total automotive revenue. The Energy division, driven by Megapack demand and Supercharger network revenue, is now Tesla's second-largest revenue contributor.

title: FSD v14 Announced: True Level 4 Autonomy Target
summary: Tesla announces next-gen FSD aimed at achieving full Level 4 autonomous driving by year-end.
body: Tesla has announced FSD v14, a major milestone update targeting true Level 4 autonomous driving capability. The new version will leverage an upgraded hardware suite and a dramatically expanded training dataset. Tesla expects to begin testing in select geofenced areas by Q4 2026.

title: Cybertruck Awarded Truck of the Year by MotorTrend
summary: Cybertruck wins prestigious award after a year of production and real-world validation.
body: MotorTrend has awarded the Tesla Cybertruck its coveted Truck of the Year title, citing the vehicle's unique design, exceptional performance, and innovative engineering. The award comes after a full year of production ramp and thousands of customer reviews praising the truck's versatility.

title: China Grants Tesla Full Data Security Clearance
summary: Full FSD deployment now cleared for the Chinese market after years of regulatory negotiations.
body: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology has granted Tesla full data security clearance, removing the final regulatory barrier to deploying FSD in the Chinese market. The approval opens the door to Tesla's largest potential FSD market by vehicle volume.

title: Tesla Partners with SpaceX for Starlink Vehicle Connectivity
summary: All new Tesla vehicles to feature built-in Starlink satellite internet connectivity.
body: Tesla and SpaceX have announced a partnership to integrate Starlink satellite internet connectivity into all new Tesla vehicles starting Q3 2026. The feature will enable high-speed internet access in remote areas, significantly improving navigation, streaming, and FSD capabilities in areas without cellular coverage.

title: TSLA Added to Dow Jones Industrial Average
summary: Tesla replaces Intel in the prestigious 30-stock index, marking a historic milestone.
body: The S&P Dow Jones Indices committee has announced that Tesla will replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, effective immediately. The inclusion marks Tesla's recognition as a blue-chip industrial company and is expected to drive additional institutional fund inflows.

title: Model S Plaid Sets New Nurburgring Sedan Record
summary: Updated Model S Plaid breaks its own record with a 7:18 lap time at the legendary circuit.
body: A factory-spec Tesla Model S Plaid has set a new Nurburgring Nordschleife record for production sedans, completing the 12.94-mile course in 7 minutes and 18 seconds. The run was verified by independent timing and marks an improvement of 12 seconds over the previous Tesla record.

title: Tesla Reaches 2 Million Vehicles Produced in 2026
summary: Annualized production rate crosses the 2 million mark for the first time.
body: Tesla's global production has reached an annualized rate of 2 million vehicles, a milestone achieved through capacity expansions at Giga Shanghai, Giga Berlin, and Giga Texas. The company is now the 10th largest automaker globally by volume and the most valuable by market capitalization.
